column12: CONTROL SYSTEM FOR A LIQUID PUMP SPRAYER
column13: A battery-powered liquid pump sprayer having a control system capable of providing the user with a selectable series of defined spray application pressures, flow rates, and patterns that are accurately sustained over the duration of a spray application session. The pump sprayer has a control system for use with a battery having a voltage supply amount and a motor having a voltage demand amount that is less than the voltage supply amount. A microcontroller of the control system is coupled to the battery and the motor, and is programmed to provide a supply voltage from the battery to the motor and to ensure that the supply voltage is at least as much as the voltage demand amount

column12: Passive alignment of optical fibers with optical elements
column13: Articles and methods for manufacturing pigtailed planar optical devices are disclosed. The articles and methods include providing a tool including a substrate having a stepped region. The tool is capable of forming elements such as grippers or waveguides on a device substrate having different heights.
column15: BOTET ALFREDO DANIEL;;CARACCI STEPHEN JOSEPH;;FUSCO ADAM JOSEPH;;GARNER SEAN MATTHEW;;LI CHENG-CHUNG

column12: LARGE DIMENSION SILICON CARBIDE SINGLE CRYSTALLINE MATERIALS WITH REDUCED CRYSTALLOGRAPHIC STRESS
column13: Silicon carbide (SiC) materials including SiC wafers and SiC boules and related methods are disclosed that provide large dimension SiC wafers with reduced crystallographic stress. Growth conditions for SiC materials include maintaining a generally convex growth surface of SiC crystals, adjusting differences in front-side to back-side thermal profiles of growing SiC crystals, supplying sufficient source flux to allow commercially viable growth rates for SiC crystals, and reducing the inclusion of contaminants or non-SiC particles in SiC source materials and corresponding SiC crystals. By forming larger dimension SiC crystals that exhibit lower crystallographic stress, overall dislocation densities that are associated with missing or additional planes of atoms may be reduced, thereby improving crystal quality and usable SiC crystal growth heights.

column12: LARGE DIMENSION SILICON CARBIDE SINGLE CRYSTALLINE MATERIALS WITH REDUCED CRYSTALLOGRAPHIC STRESS
column13: Silicon carbide (SiC) materials including SiC wafers and SiC boules and related methods are disclosed that provide large dimension SiC wafers with reduced crystallographic stress. Growth conditions for SiC materials include maintaining a generally convex growth surface of SiC crystals, adjusting differences in front-side to back-side thermal profiles of growing SiC crystals, supplying sufficient source flux to allow commercially viable growth rates for SiC crystals, and reducing the inclusion of contaminants or non-SiC particles in SiC source materials and corresponding SiC crystals. By forming larger dimension SiC crystals that exhibit lower crystallographic stress, overall dislocation densities that are associated with missing or additional planes of atoms may be reduced, thereby improving crystal quality and usable SiC crystal growth heights.

column12: 감소된 결정학적 응력을 갖는 큰 치수의 실리콘 카바이드단결정질 재료들
column13: 감소된 결정학적 응력을 갖는 큰 치수의 SiC 웨이퍼를 제공하는, SiC 웨이퍼들 및 SiC 부울들을 포함하는 실리콘 카바이드(SiC) 재료들 및 관련된 방법들이 개시된다. SiC 재료들의 성장 조건들은, SiC 결정들의 대체로 볼록한 성장 표면을 유지하는 것, 성장하는 SiC 결정들의 전면측 대 배면측 열 프로파일들에서의 차이들을 조정하는 것, SiC 결정들에 대해 상업적으로 실행가능한 성장 속도들을 허용하기에 충분한 소스 플럭스를 공급하는 것, 및 SiC 소스 재료들 및 대응하는 SiC 결정들에 오염물질들 또는 비-SiC 입자들의 혼입을 감소시키는 것을 포함한다. 더 낮은 결정학적 응력을 나타내는 더 큰 치수의 SiC 결정들을 형성함으로써, 누락되거나 추가된 원자 평면들과 연관되는 전체 전위 밀도(dislocation density)들이 감소될 수 있음으로써, 결정 품질 및 가용 SiC 결정 성장 높이들을 향상시킨다.
